message:
Merge pull request #9856 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-09-30 22:08 UTC

{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [ { "sha": "0865a18e163b525fcb1e4b9edf992f9e4f692100", "filename": "docs/fundamentals/configure-security.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 18, "deletions": 0, "changes": 18, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md?ref=db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096", "patch": "@@ -50,6 +50,24 @@ Reduce credential-related risk by implementing modern identity standards.\n | [Require multifactor authentication for device join and device registration using user action](zero-trust-protect-identities.md#require-multifactor-authentication-for-device-join-and-device-registration-using-user-action) | Microsoft Entra ID P1 |\n | [Enable Microsoft Entra ID security defaults](zero-trust-protect-identities.md#enable-microsoft-entra-id-security-defaults) | None (included with Microsoft Entra ID) |\n \n+## Protect tenants and isolation production systems\n+\n+| Check | Minimum required license |\n+|---|---|\n+| [Permissions to create new tenants are limited to the Tenant Creator role](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#permissions-to-create-new-tenants-are-limited-to-the-tenant-creator-role) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Allow/Deny lists of domains to restrict external collaboration are configured](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#allowdeny-lists-of-domains-to-restrict-external-collaboration-are-configured) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Guests are not assigned high privileged directory roles](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-are-not-assigned-high-privileged-directory-roles) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P2 or Microsoft ID Governance for PIM |\n+| [Guests can't invite other guests](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-cant-invite-other-guests) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Guests have restricted access to directory objects](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-have-restricted-access-to-directory-objects) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [App instance property lock is configured for all multitenant applications](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#app-instance-property-lock-is-configured-for-all-multitenant-applications) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Guests don't have long lived sign-in sessions](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-dont-have-long-lived-sign-in-sessions) | Microsoft Entra ID P1 |\n+| [Guest access is protected by strong authentication methods](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guest-access-is-protected-by-strong-authentication-methods) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P1 recommended for Conditional Access |\n+| [Guest self-service sign-up via user flow is disabled](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guest-self-service-sign-up-via-user-flow-is-disabled) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Outbound cross-tenant access settings are configured](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#outbound-cross-tenant-access-settings-are-configured) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P1 recommended for Conditional Access |\n+| [Guests don't own apps in the tenant](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-dont-own-apps-in-the-tenant) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [All guests have a sponsor](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#all-guests-have-a-sponsor) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P2 or Microsoft ID Governance for entitlement managed and access reviews |\n+| [Inactive guest identities are disabled or removed from the tenant](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#inactive-guest-identities-are-disabled-or-removed-from-the-tenant) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P2 or Microsoft ID Governance for entitlement managed and access reviews |\n+\n ## Protect networks\n \n Protect your network perimeter." }, { "sha": "1296ce5b482f038c7a2254ea8d467fe58eff9930", "filename": "docs/fundamentals/custom-security-attributes-overview.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcustom-security-attributes-overview.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcustom-security-attributes-overview.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fcustom-security-attributes-overview.md?ref=db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096", "patch": "@@ -37,6 +37,7 @@ Custom security attributes **aren't** supported in the following areas:\n \n - [Microsoft Entra Domain Services](/entra/identity/domain-services/overview)\n - [Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) token claims](~/identity-platform/saml-claims-customization.md)\n+- [JSON Web Token claims](/entra/identity-platform/security-tokens)\n \n ## Features of custom security attributes\n " }, { "sha": "848e3805fc5a79d2f9e67653ab84641e796e1f01", "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/concept-b2b-guest-access.md", "status": "added", "additions": 44, "deletions": 0, "changes": 44, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-b2b-guest-access.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-b2b-guest-access.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-b2b-guest-access.md?ref=db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@\n+---\n+title: Learn about Global Secure Access B2B Guest Access (Preview)\n+description: Learn how Global Secure Access enables secure B2B guest access for external partners through Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop with enhanced security controls.\n+author: kenwith \n+ms.author: kenwith\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.topic: concept-article\n+ms.date: 09/30/2025\n+ms.service: global-secure-access\n+ms.reviewer: cagautham\n+ai-usage: ai-assisted\n+---\n+\n+# Overview of B2B guest access in Global Secure Access (preview)\n+Many organizations collaborate with external partners like vendors, contractors, and other businesses. To enable secure collaboration, resource tenants can grant users from other organizations access to their resources. Traditional solutions for external access often lack visibility and granular security controls.\n+\n+Global Secure Access, built into Microsoft Entra, addresses these challenges by leveraging existing B2B guest identities. This integration provides enhanced security features, including full Conditional Access, Continuous Access Evaluation, and cross-tenant trust, helping organizations manage and secure external user access more effectively.\n+\n+## Enable B2B guest access for Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365\n+\n+You can enable Global Secure Access on Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop instances that support external identities to provide B2B guest access. With this capability, external users—such as guests, partners, and contractors—from other organizations can securely access resources in your tenant (the resource tenant). As a resource tenant administrator, you can configure Private Access, Internet Access, and Microsoft 365 traffic policies for these third-party users, helping ensure secure and controlled access to your organization's resources.\n+\n+[![Diagram showing an overview of B2B guest access in Global Secure Access.](media/concept-b2b-guest-access/guest-access-overview.png)](media/concept-b2b-guest-access/guest-access-overview.png#lightbox)\n+\n+To enable B2B guest access for Windows 365 or Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) virtual machines using Global Secure Access, follow these steps:\n+\n+1. Configure your Windows 365 or Azure Virtual Desktop VM instance to use external ID linking. Learn more in [Configure external ID linking](/azure/virtual-desktop/authentication#external-identity).\n+\n+1. Onboard your organization to Global Secure Access. See [onboarding instructions](/entra/global-secure-access/overview-what-is-global-secure-access#licensing-overview).\n+\n+1. Set up one or more Global Secure Access traffic forwarding profiles and assign them to users with external IDs. Learn more in [Configure traffic forwarding profiles](/entra/global-secure-access/quickstart-access-admin-center) and [Assign users to profiles](/entra/external-id/what-is-b2b).\n+\n+1. Install and configure the Global Secure Access client on the virtual machines. See [Installation guide for the Global Secure Access client](/entra/global-secure-access/how-to-install-windows-client).\n+\n+Once configured, the Global Secure Access client automatically connects to the tenant associated with the VM instance using the external ID.\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [Global Secure Access client for Windows](how-to-install-windows-client.md)\n+- [Global Secure Access client for Android](how-to-install-android-client.md)\n+- [Global Secure Access client for macOS](how-to-install-macos-client.md)\n+- [Global Secure Access client for iOS](how-to-install-ios-client.md)\n+- [Client for Windows version release notes](reference-windows-client-release-history.md)\n+- [Known limitations](/entra/global-secure-access/reference-current-known-limitations#b2b-guest-access-limitations)" }, { "sha": "e0cabc7e0157822f0ee02c92ee4c518a354c4519", "filename": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fmedia%2Fconcept-b2b-guest-access%2Fguest-access-overview.png", "contents_url": }, { "sha": "57bd5261b39eaa918cbf2ca7f4a10a9f1fa22d52", "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/reference-current-known-limitations.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 5, "deletions": 1, "changes": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-current-known-limitations.md", "contents_url": +5,7 @@ author: HULKsmashGithub\n ms.topic: reference\n ms.author: jayrusso\n manager: dougeby\n-ms.date: 09/08/2025\n+ms.date: 09/23/2025\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n \n \n@@ -268,3 +268,7 @@ Known limitations for Internet Access include:\n - Transport Layer Security (TLS) inspection is in development.\n - URL path based filtering and URL categorization for HTTP and HTTPS traffic are in development.\n - Traffic available for acquisition in the Microsoft traffic profile isn't available for acquisition in the Internet Access traffic profile.\n+\n+## B2B guest access (preview) limitations\n+\n+- Multi-session Azure Virtual Desktop is not supported by the Global Secure Access clients.\n\\ No newline at end of file" }, { "sha": "f73e066a222e5af64daf8b652704fe9c8f79a0dd", "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fid-protection%2Fhowto-export-risk-data.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-protection%2Fhowto-export-risk-data.md?ref=db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096", "patch": "@@ -3,7 +3,7 @@ title: Export and use Microsoft Entra ID Protection data\n description: Learn about the many long-term data storage and monitoring options for exporting risk data from Microsoft Entra ID Protection.\n ms.service: entra-id-protection\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 08/06/2025\n+ms.date: 09/30/2025\n author: shlipsey3\n ms.author: sarahlipsey\n manager: pwongera\n@@ -67,7 +67,7 @@ The following tables are of most interest to Microsoft Entra ID Protection admin\n - ServicePrincipalRiskEvents - Provides data like the **Workload identity detections** report.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Log Analytics only has visibility into data as it is streamed. Events prior to enabling the sending of events from Microsoft Entra ID do not appear.\n+> Log Analytics only has visibility into data as it is streamed. Events prior to enabling the sending of events from Microsoft Entra ID don't appear.\n \n ### Sample queries\n \n@@ -109,6 +109,12 @@ AADUserRiskEvents\n \n Access more queries and visual insights based on AADUserRiskEvents and AADRisky Users logs in the [Impact analysis of risk-based access policies workbook](workbook-risk-based-policy-impact.md).\n \n+### Risk analysis\n+\n+Organizations can reduce security operations center (SOC) workloads and support overhead with risk-based Conditional Access policies. Learn more in the following video, **Mastering risk analysis with Microsoft Entra ID Protection**.\n+\n+ > [!VIDEO abb7d7fe-4155-4ee1-bcce-afa027d22f8d]\n+\n ## Storage account\n \n By routing logs to an Azure storage account, you can keep data for longer than the default retention period." }, { "sha": "7310e2d8f0901fc3f0b86d34fef0f0e10ea4f7ff", "filename": "docs/identity/conditional-access/agent-optimization.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 13, "deletions": 1, "changes": 14, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md?ref=db355f30fc38b3641f07db65cd091ed9b767b096", "patch": "@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n manager: dougeby\n ms.reviewer: lhuangnorth\n \n-ms.date: 09/24/2025\n+ms.date: 09/30/2025\n \n ms.update-cycle: 180-days\n ms.service: entra-id\n@@ -149,6 +149,18 @@ There are several key points to consider regarding the identity and permissions\n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/agent-optimization/identity-permissions.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the identity and permissions section in the Conditional Access Optimization agent settings.\" lightbox=\"media/agent-optimization/identity-permissions.png\":::\n \n+### ServiceNow integration\n+\n+Organizations that use the [ServiceNow plugin for Security Copilot](/copilot/security/plugin-servicenow) can now have the Conditional Access optimization agent create ServiceNow incidents for each new suggestion the agent generates. This allows IT and security teams to track, review, and approve or reject agent suggestions within existing ServiceNow workflows. At this time, only change requests (CHG) are supported.\n+\n+To use the ServiceNow integration, your organization must have the [ServiceNow plugin](/copilot/security/plugin-servicenow) configured.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/agent-optimization/agent-service-now-integration-setting.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the ServiceNow integration settings.\" lightbox=\"media/agent-optimization/agent-service-now-integration-setting.png\":::\n+\n+When the ServiceNow plugin is turned on in the Conditional Access optimization agent settings, each new suggestion from the agent creates a ServiceNow incident. The incident includes details about the suggestion, such as the type of policy, the users or groups affected, and the rationale behind the recommendation. The integration also provides a feedback loop: The agent monitors the state of the ServiceNow incident and can automatically implement the change when the incident is approved.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/agent-optimization/agent-service-now-integration-ticket.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the ServiceNow integration within an agent suggestion.\" lightbox=\"media/agent-optimization/agent-service-now-integration-ticket.png\":::\n+\n ### Custom instructions\n \n You can tailor the policy to your needs using the optional **Custom Instructions** field. This setting allows you to provide a prompt to the agent as part of its execution. These instructions can be used to:" }, { "sha": "28de9c8488a9414bebe3e6f0dc05652bdf13f479", "filename": -100,12 +100,11 @@ This section guides you through the steps to configure the Microsoft Entra provi\n \n |Attribute|Type|Supported for filtering|Required by BIC Cloud Design|\n |---|---|---|---|\n- |userName|String|✓|✓|\n- |emails[type eq \"work\"].value|String|✓|✓|\n- |active|Boolean||✓|\n- |roles[primary eq \"True\"].value|String||✓|\n- |displayName|String||✓|\n- |urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User:organization|String||✓|\n+ |userName|String|✓|✓\n+ |emails[type eq \"work\"].value|String|✓|✓\n+ |active|Boolean||✓\n+ |displayName|String||✓\n+ |urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User:organization|String||✓\n \n 1. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Synchronize Microsoft Entra groups to BIC Cloud Design**.\n " } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces new documentation for B2B guest access within Global Secure Access, detailing its use with Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365, alongside limitations. It also enhances the Conditional Access agent optimization guide with ServiceNow integration details and adds an image related to this feature. Other updates include adding JSON Web Token claims to the unsupported list for custom security attributes and a minor adjustment to the date in the Microsoft Entra ID Protection export data guide. Finally, a minor edit is made to the BIC Cloud Design provisioning tutorial's attribute mapping.

author: Taojunshen
message:
Merge pull request #9855 from MicrosoftDocs/repo_sync_working_branch

Confirm merge from repo_sync_working_branch to main to sync with https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs (branch main)

    "patch": "@@ -100,12 +100,11 @@ This section guides you through the steps to configure the Microsoft Entra provi\n \n    |Attribute|Type|Supported for filtering|Required by BIC Cloud Design|\n    |---|---|---|---|\n-    |userName|String|✓|✓|\n-    |emails[type eq \"work\"].value|String|✓|✓|\n-    |active|Boolean||✓|\n-    |roles[primary eq \"True\"].value|String||✓|\n-    |displayName|String||✓|\n-    |urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User:organization|String||✓|\n+    |userName|String|✓|✓\n+    |emails[type eq \"work\"].value|String|✓|✓\n+    |active|Boolean||✓\n+    |displayName|String||✓\n+    |urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User:organization|String||✓\n \n 1. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Synchronize Microsoft Entra groups to BIC Cloud Design**.\n "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces a minor documentation update to clarify that custom security attributes are not supported in JSON Web Token (JWT) claims. Additionally, it refines the attribute mapping table in a tutorial for provisioning BIC Cloud Design users, removing the "roles" attribute as it's no longer marked as required by the application.

Microsoft Entra ID P2 or Microsoft ID Governance for PIM |\n+| [Guests can't invite other guests](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-cant-invite-other-guests) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Guests have restricted access to directory objects](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-have-restricted-access-to-directory-objects) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [App instance property lock is configured for all multitenant applications](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#app-instance-property-lock-is-configured-for-all-multitenant-applications) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Guests don't have long lived sign-in sessions](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-dont-have-long-lived-sign-in-sessions) | Microsoft Entra ID P1 |\n+| [Guest access is protected by strong authentication methods](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guest-access-is-protected-by-strong-authentication-methods) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P1 recommended for Conditional Access |\n+| [Guest self-service sign-up via user flow is disabled](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guest-self-service-sign-up-via-user-flow-is-disabled) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [Outbound cross-tenant access settings are configured](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#outbound-cross-tenant-access-settings-are-configured) | Microsoft Entra ID Free
Microsoft Entra ID P1 recommended for Conditional Access |\n+| [Guests don't own apps in the tenant](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#guests-dont-own-apps-in-the-tenant) | Microsoft Entra ID Free |\n+| [All guests have a sponsor](zero-trust-protect-tenants.md#all-guests-have-a-sponsor) | Microsoft Entra ID Free

Microsoft Entra ID P2 or Microsoft ID Governance for entitlement managed and access reviews |\n+\n ## Protect networks\n \n Protect your network perimeter." }. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces new recommendations for protecting tenants and isolating production systems within Microsoft Entra ID. It adds a section detailing various security checks and their minimum required licenses, focusing on restricting guest access, managing external collaboration, and securing app instances. These additions aim to enhance tenant security and isolation.
